metadata.titleEn: Geochronology and mineral isotope data set of felsic to basic granulites in southeastern margin of North China
metadata.description: The data are the radioactive isotope dating data, mineral isotope composition data and seismic wave velocity data of metamorphic rocks in the lower crust. The samples were collected from Cenozoic basalts and felsic granulite, neutral granulite and basic granulite xenoliths in Nushan area, Anhui Province, southeastern North China Craton. The U-Pb isotopic data were obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The data of mineral isotopic composition were obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Rock seismic wave data are estimated by binocular lens and calculated by empirical formula. The obtained data reconstruct the fine structure and evolution of the lower crust in the southeastern margin of North China.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file. The file name "UPB. XLS" represents radioisotope data. The file name "HF" represents mineral isotope data. The file name "Vp" is the seismic wave velocity of rock.

literatureList.titleEn: Downward rejuvenation of the continental lower crust beneath the southeastern North China Craton
literatureList.referenceEn: Ping, X.Q., Zheng, J.P., Xiong, Q., Griffin, W.L., Yu, C.M., & Su, Y.P. (2019). Downward rejuvenation of the continental lower crust beneath the southeastern North China Craton.  Tectonophysics, 750, 213-228.

Concept Completion.Question: What data collection methods are used to obtain isotopic compositions in metamorphic rocks?

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used to analyze zircon U-Pb and Hf isotopes in granulites?
Feature Specification.Answer: laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, precise measurements, accurate radiometric dating, isotopic studies

Definition.Question: What is the process of obtaining radiogenic isotope dating data for metamorphic rocks, and how is it utilized in geological research?
Definition.Answer: Radiogenic isotope dating data for metamorphic rocks is obtained through laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) analysis of zircon U-Pb isotopes. This method is used to determine the age of rock formations, which helps in understanding the geological history and evolution of specific regions, such as the southeastern margin of the North China Craton.

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods for radiogenic isotope dating in metamorphic rocks compare to those used for determining mineral isotopic compositions within the same field?
Comparison.Answer: Radiogenic isotope dating is achieved by analyzing zircon U-Pb isotopes using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, while mineral isotopic compositions are determined by analyzing zircon Hf isotopes using the same technique. Both methods employ laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, highlighting a similarity in the analytical tool used, but they differ in the isotopic systems analyzed.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective behind collecting and analyzing radiogenic isotope data and seismic wave velocity data for metamorphic rocks in the southeastern margin of the North China Craton?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The main goal is to reconstruct the detailed structure and evolutionary processes of the lower crust in the southeastern margin of the North China Craton. This is achieved by using radiogenic isotope dating through laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry to analyze zircon U-Pb isotopes and mineral isotope compositions, providing insight into the geological history and characteristics of the region.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry to analyze zircon U-Pb isotopes for determining the age of metamorphic rocks?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps include collecting samples from the desired region, such as the lower crustal metamorphic rocks in the southeastern margin of the North China Craton, preparing zircon samples for analysis, setting up the laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry system to target zircon U-Pb isotopes, and conducting the isotopic analysis to derive radiometric dating information.
